page.title: 07Farming
page.content: Farming is an important part of life in the block. It consists mainly of sheep farming,although some herds of beef cattle are also raised. The sheep graze the less productive hill land in the summer and are brought down when necessary for the winter or market. Much of the valley land is used for grazing or the raising of crops for silage. The land is subject to flooding which makes it very fertile. Fisheries: Glan Gors lake is being stocked with salmon at the rate of 18O per month. They are brought from a fishery in Scotland. Some fish are later taken from the lake to be smoked and sold.
